labels.analysis: The DeepSRT Server is designed to automatically generate concise summaries for YouTube videos. Its core functionality revolves around video content processing and summarization, offering users the ability to choose between narrative and bullet-point formats. The server supports multiple languages, enhancing accessibility, and integrates seamlessly with MCP-enabled environments. The only available tool, "get_summary," directly reflects this summarization capability.
labels.reasoning: The primary label, "Content Creation," was chosen because the server's main purpose is to generate summaries for video content, which is a form of content processing and creation. "Web Search & Research" is included as a secondary label since video summaries can be valuable for research purposes. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories sufficiently describe the server's functionality.

tools.name: get_summary
tools.description: Get summary for a YouTube video

server_info_crawled.name: DeepSRT Server
server_info_crawled.author: @DeepSRT/deepsrt-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Generate concise summaries for YouTube videos effortlessly. Choose between narrative and bullet-point formats, and enjoy multi-language support for a seamless experience. Integrate easily with MCP-enabled environments to enhance your video content accessibility.

tools.name: get_summary
tools.description: Get summary for a YouTube video

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@DeepSRT/deepsrt-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
